articles.author: Al Jazeera
articles.title: Why does NASA want a time zone on the moon? - Al Jazeera English
articles.description: NASA has been tasked with determining a standard time zone for the moon, but it’s more complicated than you might think.
articles.content:
The United States government has tasked its space agency, NASA, with establishing a standard time zone for the moon, which will be known as Coordinated Lunar Time (CLT).
In a memo issued on April 2,… [+5021 chars]

articles.title: Scientists Discover 82-Feet-Long Ancient “Giant Fish Lizard” in the UK - SciTechDaily
articles.description: The fossilised remains of a second gigantic jawbone measuring more than two metres long has been found on a beach in Somerset, UK. Experts have identified the bones as belonging to the jaws of a new species of enormous ichthyosaur, a type of prehistoric marin…
articles.content: A second two-meter-long ichthyosaur jawbone discovered in Somerset, UK, has unveiled a new giant species, Ichthyotitan severnensis, dating back 202 million years, adding significant insight into Tria… [+6628 chars]

articles.title: Space photo of the week: Bizarre 'Helix Galaxy' is unlike any other in the universe. Can you see why? - Livescience.com
articles.description: The Helix Galaxy is a rare "polar ring" galaxy found near the Big Dipper. Its odd shape and history set it apart from every other galaxy we know of.
articles.content:
What it is: NGC 2685, a lenticular and "polar ring" galaxy 
Where it is: 40 million light-years away, in the constellation Ursa Major 
When it was shared: April 10, 2024

articles.title: Sailing on sunlight: NASA ACS3 solar sail mission to launch next week - Interesting Engineering
articles.description: NASA’s ACS3 mission will demonstrate the feasibility of solar sails. These could eventually enable “low-cost missions to the Moon, Mars, and beyond.”
articles.content:
For the following weeks, it will then perform several pointing maneuvers to demonstrate orbit raising and lowering.

articles.title: Lemur's lament: When one vulnerable species stalks another - Phys.org
articles.description: What can be done when one threatened animal kills another? Scientists studying critically endangered lemurs in Madagascar confronted this difficult reality when they witnessed attacks on lemurs by another vulnerable species, a carnivore called a fosa.
